Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 10 Dec 2018If you are broke, I'd suggest not getting a credit card.However, if you must, I would suggest checking out the cards' eligibility on the cards' websites. Usually you'd have to have an income of $30k annually. 0 comments1

Gabriel LeeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 09 Dec 2018Hi, you can apply for a credit card so long as you meet the card's requirement(s) which is usually having a minimum annual income of $30k. However for your case, I'd suggest not to get a credit card if you feel that you won't be able to pay the credit card bill on time as it'll incur late payment charges and interest fees which is pretty high. You should consider getting a debit card instead0 comments1
